clinical_study.brief_title: Tracheal Occlusion To Accelerate Lung Growth (TOTAL) Trial for Severe Pulmonary Hypoplasia
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Trial of Fetoscopic Endoluminal Tracheal Occlusion (FETO) Versus Expectant Management During Pregnancy in Fetuses With Left Sided and Isolated Congenital Diaphragma Hernia and Severe Pulmonary Hypoplasia.

brief_summary.textblock: This trial investigates whether prenatal intervention improves survival rate of fetuses with isolated congenital diaphragmatic hernia and severe pulmonary hypoplasia, as compared to expectant management during pregnancy, both followed by standardized postnatal care.

primary_outcome.measure: Survival at discharge from neonatal intensive care unit
primary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge from neonatal intensive care unit
primary_outcome.description: The baby can be discharged either alive (and then it qualifies as "surviving at discharge") or dead. Not discharged babies have not reached the primary endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: number of days in Nenoatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU)
secondary_outcome.description: As long as the baby is in the hospital, it is hospitalized either in NICU or in another, less intensive care unit. The number of days in NICU is an outcome variable, expressed in days.

secondary_outcome.measure: presence of neonatal sepsis, intraventricular haemorrhage,retinopathy grade III or higher
number of days till full enteral feeding
requirement for use of patch for repair
pulmonary function at one year of age

arm_group.description: fetoscopic balloon occlusion at 27 to 30 weeks of gestation

intervention.description: percutaneous fetoscopy, positioning of endoluminal balloon at 27-30 weeks and whenever possible elective removal at 34 weeks
pregnancy surveillance for fetal wellbeing, development of polyhydramnios and cervical shortening

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Consenting subjects
- fetus with isolated left-sided Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia (CDH) and
- severe pulmonary hypoplasia defined as O/E LHR <25 % irrespective of the liver position as measured prior to 29 wks + 6 days at the FETO center
Exclusion Criteria:
- Maternal contraindication to fetal intervention
- technical or maternal limitation to fetoscopy
- preterm labour or cervix<15 mm
- refusal to return to FETO center during time period airways are occluded
